meanings.definition: jivers (noun): people who engage in lively and rhythmic dancing
meanings.sent1: At the party, the jivers moved gracefully to the music.
meanings.sent2: The jivers at the dance competition impressed the judges with their moves.
meanings.sent3: The jivers at the wedding reception added joy and energy to the celebration.
meanings.sent4: The jivers on the dance floor seemed to be in perfect harmony with the music.
meanings.sent5: The jivers' passion for dancing was contagious and inspiring to everyone around them.

meanings.definition: jivers (verb): to dance energetically and rhythmically
meanings.sent1: When the music started, she couldn't help but jivers with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends decided to jivers all night long at the club.
meanings.sent3: He jivers around the living room, making his family laugh with his moves.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the trees seemed to jivers in the wind's playful dance.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the waves of the ocean jiversed gently against the shore.
